byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Benghazi, Libya, and Kareem Fahim from Misurata, Libya.

abstract: Mustafa Abdel-Jalil, leader of Libya's transitional government, declares that the revolution has ended, setting the country on path to elections and vows that new government will be based on Islamic tenets.
snippet: The leader of Libya’s transitional government declared to thousands of revelers that Libya’s revolution had ended, setting the country on the path to elections.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: The leader of Libya’s transitional government declared to thousands of revelers that Libya’s revolution had ended, setting the country on the path to elections.

headline.main: Revolution Won, Top Libyan Official Vows a New and More Pious State
headline.print_headline: Revolution Won, Top Libyan Official Promises Elections and a More Pious State
headline.seo: Abdel-Jalil Promises a Role for Islam in a New Libya
